content.title: Punjab Farm Tourism Scheme
content.department: Department of Tourism & Cultural Affairs, Government of Punjab
content.details: The scheme 'Punjab Farm Tourism Scheme' was launched to provide tourists with a clean, hygienic, and comfortable stay in farmhouses across Punjab. It aims to offer a cultural experience to domestic and foreign tourists through exposure to village life, while also providing additional income sources to the farming community.
benefits: A useful source of additional income to the farm owners of the registered Farm Stay units.
Registered Farm stay units shall be allowed to use Punjab Tourism Logo on their sign boards.
Support from the Department of Tourism in marketing the Farm Stay unit through various promotional activities.
eligibility: Farm stay units having an area of at least 2.5 acres.
Gold category requires more than 5 acres with specific accommodation standards.
Silver category requires up to 5 acres with specific accommodation standards.
content.application_process: Online application through the Department of Tourism's web portal.
documents_required: Additional relevant background information, if any
Coloured photographs of the property and the rooms proposed to be let out
An affidavit for medical help and transportation facility
Photo Identity proof of the owner
Proof of having paid the necessary fee

faqs.question: What is the 'Punjab Farm Tourism Scheme'?
faqs.answer: The scheme envisages to provide to tourists with a clean, hygienic, and comfortable stay in the farmhouses spread across the State of Punjab.

faqs.question: What is the aim of this scheme?
faqs.answer: The scheme also aims to provide a cultural experience to domestic and foreign tourists through their exposure to village life.

faqs.question: Which department has launched this scheme?
faqs.answer: Department of Tourism & Cultural Affairs, Government of Punjab.

faqs.question: What is the 'Farm Stay unit'?
faqs.answer: A farm stay unit will be a property having an area of at least 2.5 acres or above with suitable accommodation built inside for providing a comfortable stay to the guests/tourists.

faqs.question: Who can apply under the scheme?
faqs.answer: The owners of the properties in Punjab are eligible to apply under the scheme.
